text: Add the egg yolks, egg white, milk water and cardamom to a large mixing bowl. Mix until well blended. Stir in the flour and salt. Keep stirring until the dough forms into a ball. Turn the dough out onto a large, lightly floured surface. Knead until nice and smooth. Cover the ball of dough with a kitchen towel. Allow to rest for 2 hours. Roll the dough into balls about the size of walnuts. Then flatten them into ⁄8 inch (0.3 cm) thick circles. Fold the circles in half. Crimp the edges together with a fork. Cover again with the towel. Rest 5 minutes. Meanwhile, heat the oil to 365 °F (185 °C). Perform a test to see if the oil is hot. (see 'tips') Lower some cookies into the oil with a slotted spoon. Watch for splattering oil, it's very hot. Fry for only 1 minute. When the cookies are browned all over, they're done! Continue frying, in batches. Careful not to crowd the cookies. Remove the cookies from the oil with the slotted spoon. Place them on paper towel to drain. Sprinkle with powdered sugar. Enjoy! Finished.
